{"step_by_step_thinking": "Feline Infectious Peritonitis (FIP) is a disease that affects cats. It is caused by a virus called Feline Coronavirus (FCoV). There are two types of FCoV: Feline enteric coronavirus (FECV) and Feline infectious peritonitis virus (FIPV). FIPV is believed to be a mutation of FECV. Therefore, the FIP virus is indeed thought to be a mutated strain of the Feline enteric Coronavirus.", "answer_choice": "A"}
